column4: Is there any other bloody way to load a module at boot time, EXCEPT /etc/modules ?
Sans
put the load line in rc.local  'modprobe <module>'  but /etc/modules is the best way
I tried both. And none is working :(
yup. And I can`t figure out what.
you can load it manually once the machine is up?
Dr_Willis : I can load it manually.
what module?
b44 (for broadcom 44100 ethernet wired)
ew...hahaha
I hate broadcom.  always an issue
Yeah. I get the same feeling
did you check /var/log/syslog for errors after a boot?  or check dmesg output?
dmesg shows nothing. Let me see in syslog
this is what I get in syslog upon modprobing the module: "Apr 30 16:24:39 Sisif kernel: [ 6032.212285] eth0: Broadcom 44xx/47xx 10/100BaseT Ethernet 00:19:b9:85:80:f6"
do you get that on boot?
noup. I just "modprobe -r b44 && modprobe b44" now
do you want me to pastebin my syslog so you can take a look there? I`m kinda of a noob to linux and I`m not sure what to look for.
sorry boss is walking around in our pod... :)  go ahead and pastebin it...I'll take a peak
there you go: http://paste.ubuntu.com/8928/

it's going to be something related to ndiswrapper...unfortunately I can't help much more on that...I don't use wireless and never have so I am clueless....but I bet ndiswrapper is getting in the way....
you know what`s weird? It was working fine until I upgraded from 7.10 to 8.04 :)
